abstract: President Barack Obama’s proposal to ban banks from engaging in in proprietary trading has thrown a wrench into RBS Sempra’s plans to sell its global commodities trading business to JPMorgan Chase for $4 billion.
snippet: President Barack Obama’s proposal to ban banks from engaging in in proprietary trading has thrown a wrench into RBS Sempra’s plans to sell its global commodities trading business to JPMorgan Chase for $4 billion.
lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama’s proposal to ban banks from engaging in in proprietary trading has thrown a wrench into RBS Sempra‘s plans to sell its global commodities trading business to JPMorgan Chase for £2.5 billion ($4 billion), according to press reports.

headline.main: JPMorgan Said to Pass on RBS Sempra’s U.S. Unit
